name: entry-scale-esx
overview:
Compute Hypervisor
VMWare® ESX®
Block Storage
provided by VMWare
Object Storage
minimal Swift on Control Plane servers

Node roles

  • Control Plane, includes Deployer node (3 nodes)
  • ESX Compute (minimum 1 node, added post-install by EON, please see ESX install docs for more information
  • OVSvApp (minimum 1 node, added post-install by EON, please see ESX install docs for more information

This cloud model requires the following networks:

IMPI/iLO network, connected to the deployer and the IPMI/iLO ports of all physical servers.

A pair of bonded NICs which are used used by the following networks:

  • External API - This is the network that users will use to make requests to the cloud
  • External VM - This is the network that will be used to provide access to VMs (via floating IP addresses)
  • Guest - This is the network that will carry traffic between VMs on private networks within the cloud
  • Cloud Management - This is the network that will be used for all internal traffic between the cloud services

name: entry-scale-kvm-ceph
overview:
Compute Hypervisor
KVM
Storage
Ceph®
Object Storage
minimal Swift Resources are provided by the control plane

Node roles

  • Control Plane (3), includes deployer
  • Ceph nodes (3)
  • Compute node (at least 1)

This example separates network traffic into four logical networks which are carried on a pair of bonded NICs on two physical ports.

Logical network separation:

  1. External API - used by consumers of the cloud to make requests to the cloud APIs
  2. External VM - used to provide external access to VMs (via floating IP addresses)
  3. Guest - carries traffic between VMs on private networks within the cloud (VxLAN encapsulated)
  4. Management - used for all internal traffic between the cloud services. This network is also used to provision and configure the cloud servers.

In addition, each server is connected to a dedicated IPMI/iLO network.

For more information on Ceph, see the Ceph documentation.

name: entry-scale-swift
overview:
Compute Hypervisor
KVM
Object Storage
Swift

Node roles

  • Control Plane (3), includes deployer
  • Swift object storage nodes (3)

This example separates network traffic into three logical networks which are carried on a pair of bonded NICs on two physical ports.

Logical network separation:

  1. External API - used by consumers of the cloud to make requests to the cloud APIs
  2. Management - used for all internal traffic between the cloud services. This network is also used to provision and configure the cloud servers.
  3. SWIFT - used for internal Swift communications between the Swift servers

In addition, each server is connected to a dedicated IPMI/iLO network.

For more information on Swift object storage, see the object storage documentation.

Logical network separation:

  1. External API - used by consumers of the cloud to make requests to the cloud APIs
